Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien
The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide

wikitext.*:
[[File:Agatha Carew Hunt 4 October 1965.jpg|thumb]] On [[4 October]] [[1965]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] sent '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|a letter]] to Agatha Carew Hunt'''.{{CG|C}}, p. 644{{webcite|author=[[Pieter Collier]]|articleurl=http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/press/979-30_years_Letters_of_JRR_Tolkien.php|articlename=Something to celebrate: 30 years The Letters of J. R. R. Tolkien|dated=21 January 2011|website=TL|accessed=17 July 2012}} *'''Subject:''' A stock reply (written by Tolkien's secretary on 11 May) to a letter of appreciation. However, Tolkien discovers the letter on 4 October, and adds a note of apology. *'''Publication:''' [[Wayne G. Hammond|Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull|Scull]] published a description of the letter in their [[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide|''The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide: Chronology'']] (p. 644). A photograph of the letter was reproduced in ''[[Dominic Winter Children's and Illustrated Books, Modern First Editions 2003]]''.{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details.php?reference=72440|articlename=Childrenâ€™s and Illustrated Books. 2003|dated=|website=TB|accessed=30 March 2014}} ==Transcription== {{blockquote|I am v sorry that this note was not posted until now 4/10/65. A change of secretary and a load of work suddenly imposed on me by [[Ace Books|USA "pirates"]] is responsible. I have just found this in a pile of neglect, clearing up before going away.

Best wishes

J.R.R. Tolkien}} {{References}} [[Category:Letters|Carew Hunt, Agatha]]
